transcript:
and self-derision, which appeared on his face against his will, Pierre stood with his arms hanging down and legs apart, before his brother Rhetor, and awaited his further commands. 
"And now, in token of candor, I ask you to reveal to me your chief passion," said the lat- ter. 
"My passion! I have had so many," replied Pierre. 
"That passion which more than all others caused you to waver on the path of virtue," said the Mason. 
Pierre paused, seeking a reply. 
"Wine? Gluttony? Idleness? Lazi
